content: Initialize a new Python project from scratch with pyproject.toml, src/hello_app/main.py exposing get_message()->str that returns 'hello world', and tests/test_smoke.py using unittest to validate the message.

{"summary": "Python project initialized with pyproject.toml, src/hello_app/main.py, and tests/test_smoke.py. get_message() returns 'hello world', and unittest validates it.", "project": {"language": "python"}, "files": [{"path": "pyproject.toml", "content": "[build-system]
requires = ["setuptools>=61.0"]
build-backend = "setuptools.build_meta"

[project]
name = "hello-app"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "A simple hello world app"
requires-python = ">=3.8"
dependencies = []

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "unittest-xml-reporting>=3.2.0",
]
"}, {"path": "src/hello_app/main.py", "content": "def get_message() -> str:
    return "hello world"
"}, {"path": "tests/test_smoke.py", "content": "import unittest
from hello_app.main import get_message

class TestSmoke(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_get_message(self):
        self.assertEqual(get_message(), "hello world")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    unittest.main()"}], "dependencies": {"dependencies": {}, "devDependencies": {"unittest-xml-reporting": ">=3.2.0"}, "python": [], "pythonDev": ["unittest-xml-reporting>=3.2.0"], "rust": {}, "go": {}, "cpp": {}}, "commands": ["python -m unittest discover -s tests"]}
